title: ASEvent aka. Business Activity Monitoring Message (BAMM)
description: BAMMs are used to report business activity in real time into Activity Stream

occurred_at.description: A fully qualified ISO timestamp of when the event took place. (If ommitted then server time will be used).

type.description: Event Type Identifier (lower cased and dot separated)

origin.description: Origin Identifier (lower cased and dot separated)

importance.description: The importance level of the event (See imp. levels).

description.description: A short, human readable, description of what happened.

involves.description: A list of entities involved in the event

aspects.description: A map of aspects used to report the event.

properties.description: Free format JSON structure with additional information regarding the Event.

partition.description: A isolated data partition to store the data in. '_common' is the global partition.

token.description: A token used for templated/fill-inn when reporting the event.

ab_test.description: AB Test is to simplify tracking and and results for AB Tests

id.description: The ID of the AB test

variant.description: What variant of the AB test is active

outcome.description: What is the outcome of the AB test

metric.description: Key metric outcome (Added with things in the metrics aspect)

amount.description: Key metric, monitory, outcome (Added with things in the metrics aspect)

properties.description: Free format properties to add to the AB test results

address.description: Addresses can be attached to any entity

state_code.description: Abbreviation of id of the State

country_code.description: The two letter ISO code for the country

hasc.description: The HASC code used for this are (if available)

zip_latlong.description: The Latitude Longitude pair for the postal code

latlong.description: The Latitude-Longitude pair for the address it self

attachments.description: Attachment information can be included for both event and entity messages

url.description: a fully qualified URL pointing to the attached file

filename.description: The filename to use for the attachment regardless of URL

fingerprint.description: HASH for the file to find duplicates and verify content

description.description: A general description of what is in the file

size.description: Size of the file in Bytes

created.description: Timestamp with the creation date-time of the file

updated.description: Timestamp with the last updated date-time of the file

properties.description: Free format properties to add to the attachment

metadata.description: Metadata properties used to describe the file content

cei.description: Customer Experience Index values can be used to further classify any event

client_ip.description: Used to declare the IP address in use whe an event is triggered

content.description: Can contain any semi-structured content in an event

engagement.description: -5 to +5 value indicating how strongly the event should affect the engagement score for the entities involved.

happiness.description: -5 to +5 value indicating how strongly the event should affect the happiness score for the entities involved.

care.description: -5 to +5 value indicating how strongly the event should affect the ecare score for the entities involved.

intent.description: -5 to +5 value indicating how strongly the event should affect the intent score for the entities involved.

duration.description: The duration in minutes that this rating should affect the customer score.

items_sold.description: Number of items sold to date.

items_returned.description: Number of items returned to date.

items_on_hold.description: Number of items being held-back from sales.

items_sold.description: Number of items sold to date.

items_returned.description: Number of items returned to date.

items_on_hold.description: Number of items being held-back from sales.

items_unsellable.description: Number of items that can not be sold.

items_in_stock.description: Number of items currently available to be sold

items_for_sale.description: Total number of items that have been available to be sold

price_type.description: What price type applied for these items (from Inventory)

price_category.description: What price category applied for these items (from Inventory)

accounting_key.description: Should this revenue be assigned to a specific accounting key

description.description: Does this line item have a specific description (prefer templates)

currency.description: What currency was used to pay for the item

variant.description: What product sub-type/variant was sold (from Invoentory)

payment_method.description: What payment method was used to pay for the item

card_token.description: Obfuscated Credid Card number/token for the transactions

serial_numbers.description: List of serial numbers of the products involved

line_ids.description: Unique line-item IDs for the sale

item_count.description: How many items of this product+type+variant were bought.

item_price.description: What was the price for individual item (before tax and discount)

commission_percentage.description: How many percentages of the sale should be considered commission

complimentary.description: Is this a complimentary item (not sold)

discount_percentage.description: How much discount should be deducted from the item price.

tax_percentage.description: How much tax should be added on top of the item price.

aspects.description: Aspects that can be added to item line

valid_from.description: Does the product bought have a validation period. This is the start of that period.

valid_until.description: Does the product bought have a validation period. This is the end of that period.

properties.description: Any additional/propriatary properties for the line item

metrics.description: Any metric to be included in the event/entity analytics entry [Tracked Aspect]

properties.description: Any additional/custom properties. Properties are stored natively as JSON but they are not processed automatically by AS in any way.

presentation.description: Presentation aspect contains popular presentation information

label.description: A human readable string used to represent the entity (name etc.)

details_url.description: A URI containing detailed information about the entity

thumbnail.description: A URI pointing to an image of the entity (profile picture)

description.description: A short, general, description of the entity

icon.description: A image or icon used to represent the entity in lists etc.

product_view.description: Product View aspect is used to track product exposure

context.description: In what context was the product viewed/seen

referrer.description: From where did the customer come when viewing the product.

external_id.description: A unique external ID used to look up the event or the entity

batch_id.description: A external Batch number used to identify a group of events

settings.description: A list of settings where the active settings are compiled based on all reported settings (as in Event sourcing)

tags.description: List of tags attached to an entity or an event

timed.description: A list of times or periods relevant for the entity or the event

duration.description: Duration (calculated if start/end provided but uses occurred_at as start time and occurrd_at+duration  as end time if only duration is reported

traffic_sources.description: A list of traffic sources that were involved in the event or the transaction line (For atttributions and assisted sales)

type.description: What type of traffic source was this ('campaign' for example)

referrer.description: Where did the traffic come from (usually a URL/Web Domain)

campaign.description: What was the ID of the campaign

source.description: What was the source for the traffic

medium.description: What was the medium for the traffic

term.description: Primary term(s) used (should be a list)

content.description: Any additional content used to report the traffic_source for the event
